info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mecklenburg County through 600 PM EDT... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Boydton, or 12 miles southwest of South Hill, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail and rainfall up to 1 inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Mecklenburg County, including the following locations... Beechwood, Bracey, Keats, John H Kerr Dam, Baskerville, Palmer Springs, John H Kerr Reservoir and Lake Gaston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
